text:
View 1; and 2
42nd Street, south east corner and First Avenue showing Tunnel Ventitatim Building at left.
October 3, 1940.

View 3;
#5 West 42nd Street, north side and showing old buildings located between the Salmon lower building and Bristol.

P.L. Speer.
February 21, 1922.

View 1; and 2
42nd Street, south east corner and First Avenue showing Tunnel Ventitatim Building at left.
October 3, 1940.

View 3;
#5 West 42nd Street, north side and showing old buildings located between the Salmon lower building and Bristol.

42nd Street, south east corner and First Avenue showing Tunnel Ventitatim Building at left.
October 3, 1940.

View 3;
#5 West 42nd Street, north side and showing old buildings located between the Salmon lower building and Bristol.

P.L. Speer.
February 21, 1922.

42nd Street, south side, west from the clearing at No. 340 East 42nd Street, Prospect Hill, between First and Second Avenues, as the Tudor City development begins.
May 11, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

42nd Street, west from First Avenue, through the Prospect Hill tunnel under the future site of Tudor City. Probably 1927.

Brown Brothers.

(1) First Avenue, looking Northwards from the South West corner of East 42nd Street.
March 20th, 1928

(2) The same, looking North from East 42nd Street.
October 3rd, 1940

P.L. Sperr,

42nd Street, north side, east of and from First Avenue. March 20, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

East 42nd Street (prominent structures thereon) west from First (right, not seen) to Lexington (left) Aves., showing the Chrysler and the News Buildings under construction. The first is at the N.E. corner of Lexington Ave. and 42nd Street, while the latter is on the south side of 42nd Street, between First and Second Aves. Photographers vantage point is atop a roof on 40th Street, east of Second Ave. and viewing northwestward.

August 16, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

East 42nd Street, south side, west from the East River to First Ave. Shown in the background, are two units of Tudor City; the Windsor Tower (left) and the Tudor Tower (right).
March 31, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

East 42nd Street, west from First Avenue, showing the enclosed passageway through which the streetcars pass. Atop same is the residential locale, Tudor City. This in earlier days was a rocky wasteland populated by a group of "Shanty Irish" led by one, Cocoran, and for whom this became known as "Cocoran's Roost".

July 23, 1939
No's. 1-2

P. L. Sperr

East 42nd Street, west from First Avenue, showing the enclosed passageway through which the streetcars pass. Atop same is the residential locale, Tudor City. This in earlier days was a rocky wasteland populated by a group of "Shanty Irish" led by one, Cocoran, and for whom this became known as "Cocoran's Roost".

July 23, 1939
No's. 1-2

P. L. Sperr

East 42nd Street, west from 1st Avenue, showing there, the utilitarian News Building. Same, obstructs a clear view of the Chrysler Building at Lexington Avenue. The photographer's direction is northwestward from a point on E. 40th Street.

1939

Gift of Beecher Ogden

East 42nd Street, east from First Avenue, showing the terminus of this street at the East River, Under construction at the right is the Midtown-Queens Tunnel.

1: February 1940
2&3: Sept. 28, 1940

George D. Chinn

P. L. Sperr
